column5: Just picked up a new pair of boots for icefishing today. Snowmobile type boots aprox. 12" high with rubber bottoms & insulated nylon on top. Also a fairly thick liner in them & roomy enough to tuck in my insulated coveralls. Rated for -58 deg. F.  Called Icicles and on sale at TSC for $35. I don't know how long the sale is on.  Best Wishes: Rick
Tractor Supply Company  http://www.tscstores.com/  I think granny had a fling with one of their salesmen!
Dang I was in there yesterday and didn't even see them. I've wore out my last pair. Thanks for the heads up.
Closest store to me would be in Alliston, not worth the drive for me.  Does sound like a good deal though.  Maureen

Tried the boots out today. After fishing today I can only say " 2 thumbs up". Fishing was slow & I got skunked but it was so cold & windy I only lasted 3 hrs. Seen about 6 small pike caught. My feet were not the problem which is usually the first place I start to get cold. At times you could only see about a hundred yards but what was worse was all the snow blowing in your hole & quickly slushing over.  Best Wishes: Rick
